intro: Sclerocaryopsis, commonly known as the African grassnut, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its woody pods and small, often edible seeds. The plant is native to regions of Africa, particularly in the savannas and grasslands. Sclerocaryopsis species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, and they are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The botanical features of Sclerocaryopsis make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
